intro: Chabertia pannonica, commonly known as the Pannonian chabertia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. The plant has slender, erect stems that bear small, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are pale blue to violet, arranged in loose spikes, and bloom from June to August. Chabertia pannonica is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
